title: Book of war

properties.name: description
properties.value: A Book of war is a book held in place of a shield, and is the God book aligned with Bandos. It can be purchased from Jossik for 5,000 coins at the Lighthouse. Books of war must be made using all four torn Bandos pages which can be purchased from other players or obtained from Treasure Trails. Equipping a book of war allows the player to preach and perform ceremonies, such as blessing, last rites, and wedding rites, by operating it (none of which have any effect on the game itself, and are simply recited lines of text), costing 25% of the player's special attack energy.

Book of war

Item ID12608

A Book of war is a book held in place of a shield, and is the God book aligned with Bandos. It can be purchased from Jossik for 5,000 coins at the Lighthouse. Books of war must be made using all four torn Bandos pages which can be purchased from other players or obtained from Treasure Trails. Equipping a book of war allows the player to preach and perform ceremonies, such as blessing, last rites, and wedding rites, by operating it (none of which have any effect on the game itself, and are simply recited lines of text), costing 25% of the player's special attack energy.

Lost books of war can be reclaimed by speaking to Jossik, complete with all pages that have been added, for no cost. Alternatively, for those who do not wish to travel to the Lighthouse, Perdu will return them to players for 14,000 coins.

The book of war can be used as a training weapon for the Nightmare Zone, as it offers a +5 prayer bonus and a +2 strength bonus. It is the only god book to give a strength bonus.

This book can be useful for melee training for low level players that don't have access to defenders or the obsidian shield yet.

As it is a Bandos-affiliated item, it can be used when collecting ecumenical keys in the Wilderness God Wars Dungeon.

Filling the Book of war currently costs 6,877 coins when buying each page individually or 17,913 when buying the item set.

Products[edit | edit source]

Book of war (or)

  • None
  • 1 × Book of war
  • 1 × Shattered relics variety ornament kit

Preaching[edit | edit source]

The player may perform certain ceremonies by right-clicking the book and selecting "Preach." Preaching expends 25% of the special attack bar. The following are the options that appear when preaching and what the player says upon selecting them.

Wedding Ceremony[edit | edit source]

  • Big High War God want Great Warriors. Because you can make more... I bind you in Big High War God name.

Last Rites[edit | edit source]

  • You not worthy of Big High War God; you die too easy.

Blessings[edit | edit source]

  • Big High War God make you strong... so you smash enemies.

Preach[edit | edit source]

  • War is best, Peace is for weak. If you not worthy of Big High War God, you get made dead soon.

Treasure Trails[edit | edit source]

Tier Emotes STASH Location Items Cost
Elite Bow South-east corner of the Edgeville Monastery, on the ground floor 6,877[c 1]
  1. ^ The cost may be higher because of the variant of the item used. The base item is god book.

[[File:Book of war detail.png|left|130px]]
A '''Book of war''' is a book held in place of a shield, and is the [[God book]] aligned with [[Bandos]]. It can be purchased from [[Jossik]] for 5,000 coins at the [[Lighthouse]]. Books of war must be made using all four torn [[Bandos page]]s which can be purchased from other players or obtained from [[Treasure Trails]]. Equipping a book of war allows the player to preach and perform ceremonies, such as blessing, last rites, and wedding rites, by operating it (none of which have any effect on the game itself, and are simply recited lines of text), costing 25% of the player's [[special attack]] energy.

Lost books of war can be reclaimed by speaking to [[Jossik]], complete with all pages that have been added, for no cost. Alternatively, for those who do not wish to travel to the Lighthouse, [[Perdu]] will return them to players for 14,000 [[coins]].

The book of war can be used as a training weapon for the [[Nightmare Zone]], as it offers a +5 [[prayer bonus]] and a +2 [[strength bonus]]. It is the only god book to give a strength bonus.

This book can be useful for melee training for low level players that don't have access to [[defenders]] or the [[obsidian shield]] yet. 

As it is a [[Bandos]]-affiliated item, it can be used when collecting [[ecumenical key]]s in the [[Wilderness God Wars Dungeon]].

'''Filling the Book of war currently costs {{Coins|{{GEP|Bandos page 1}} + {{GEP|Bandos page 2}} + {{GEP|Bandos page 3}} + {{GEP|Bandos page 4}}}} coins when buying each page individually or {{Coins|{{GEP|Book of war page set}}}} when buying the [[Book of war page set|item set]].'''
